title: Use mozbuild::config items rather than extra-bindgen-flags
body: This builds upon the patches in https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1950258

title: Streamed read for binary HTTP
body:
This is far from ready.

It also requires an MSRV update to 1.82, which is brand new, so I don't want to say that this is ready to land.

Missing:
* The writing part.  It is likely possible to cobble something together from the synchronous API easily, so I didn't spend too much time on this, but that will have to be worked out.
* Testing.  The tests I have are basic smoke tests.  I found a lot of missing coverage in a short time.
* ohttp parts.  That part should be fairly simple (it can probably reuse a lot of the `Body` implementation), but this is still likely to be non-trivial.

title: Update hpke and hpke-pq to 0.11.0
body:
This version of `hpke` moves `x25519-dalek` to a stable version, letting downstream users get the fix for https://rustsec.org/advisories/RUSTSEC-2024-0344.

The pinned version of `hpke-pq` [also fixes the CI](https://github.com/bwesterb/rust-hpke/pull/4).

title: Fix clippy lint when feature `nss` is enabled
body:
This was causing CI failures as in [1].

[1]: https://github.com/martinthomson/ohttp/actions/runs/9104919358/job/25029611078

title: Update RFC 9458 reference
body: draft-ietf-ohai-ohttp has long since been published as RFC 9458, so update some links in the READMEs.

title: Test MSRV in CI
body: Close #59. Run tests with both MSRV and stable rust toolchains.

title: Construct `ClientRequest` from `&mut KeyConfig`
body:
ClientRequests are single use so one making multiple requests needs to use the KeyConfig multiple times. Making each one from a reference rather than an owned `KeyConfig` allows this.

edit: The CI errors appear to be from the new clippy version and do not have to do with this change

title: Fix Ergonomics
body:
- patch 1 allows Server::decapsulate to take `&self` instead of `&mut self` since `Server` is not mutated
- patch 2 derives debug, clone for ohttp::Server for ergonomics downstream

clippy passes w/o warnings

title: Support using NSS in application-services
body:
Similar to the 'gecko' feature, I want to consider adding an 'app-svc' feature to use NSS for ohttp when built into application-services: https://github.com/mozilla/application-services/tree/main/components/as-ohttp-client . This is only used for iOS targets where we using static linking of NSS.

The existing ohttp build code for NSS ends up linking some of the NSS libraries statically, but calls dlopen under the covers to get softokn3.so and freebl.so. To do a full static link, instead I need to use pk11wrap_static/softokn_static/freebl_static. I made this an option for the app-svc build, but we could also change the default for NSS debug builds. My guess is that the static linking for NSS in debug for this ohttp crate was just to avoid mucking with LD_LIBRARY_PATH, in which case doing the full static link is probably a better path to the same result.

Down the road, I'd like to consider unifying the many build.rs scripts in gecko/app-svc to consolidate build system goo for gecko, etc. My thinking is to move into the application-services:nss_build_common which will become part of mozilla-unified. Then the logic around gecko builds, as well as around static nss builds could be maintained once. For now though, I'm just trying to getting the ohttp crate shipped on Firefox iOS.

If these changes are too specific to app-svc usage, I could try to make them just general parameters of the existing nss feature flag.

title: Provide constructors for ClientRequest from lists of configurations
body: While we provided a way to construct KeyConfigs from list, we didn't plumb that up into ClientRequests. This plugs that gap.

title: Add support for X25519Kyber768Draft00
body:
Maintainer of rust-hpke [prefers](https://github.com/rozbb/rust-hpke/pull/43) to wait for the final version of Kyber, before including support. I'd understand if you'd like to hold of as well because of that.

Cf. https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/draft-westerbaan-cfrg-hpke-xyber768d00/
 
cc @chris-wood

title: Bump rust-hpke to v0.10.0
body: cc @chris-wood

title: Support decoding of key configuration lists
body:
This is a strictly additive change to the API.  It exposes the function for decoding `KeyConfig` and adds a new function for decoding a list of them.

I've also included some fixes for lints added in Rust 1.69.  Those will land ahead of this in a separate change that I'll pull out.

I've a more disruptive change that I might propose as an alternative.  That one will change the API.

Closes #44.

title: Indeterminate, not indefinite
body: Potato, tomato

title: Truncation tests
body:
A more complete set of truncation tests and some guards to avoid panics.

Closes #39.

title: Check that there is enough input in read_vec
body:
This required a bunch of API changes that were a little awkward to manage.  That is the bulk of the work here.

In the end, retaining the dynamic dispatch stuff that the CLI tools were using was too hard, so that isn't quite as elegant as it was.

Closes #35.

title: loosen bhttp's url dependency
body: In mozilla-central, url >= 2.2 causes test failures, so that crate is limited to 2.1 right now (see https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1734538). This changes bhttp's url dependency to not specify which minor version is required, so that any version with major version 2 can be used.

title: Stop using env_logger
body: As noted in #32, we shouldn't be doing that.  Move it to a dev-dependency for tests.

title: Update bindgen to 0.63 and env_logger to 0.9
guard against truncated ciphertext in Aead::open (nss)
body: This fixes #30 by checking the input ciphertext length.

title: use byteorder instead of re-implementing integer serialization
body: This avoids some unwrap()s and try_from()s and delegates integer serialization to a well-known implementation.

title: avoid Pin in ParamItem
body:
Since ParamItem doesn't appear to be long-lived anyway, we should be able to use lifetimes to ensure that the data being pointed to doesn't go away or move before we're done with it.

This addresses #27.

title: make ohttp buildable in gecko
body: This bumps bindgen's version and updates build.rs so ohttp can be built in gecko.

title: Remove unnecessary mut reference.
body:
KeyConfig::select() only creates a new HpkeConfig for matching
suites; it doesn't need to modify any internal state.

title: Move configuration binding to HPKE info
body:
This takes the AAD parameter and includes it in the info string passed
to the export function of HPKE.  This ensures that the request AND the
response are bound to the configuration.

As noted, we don't really have a good reason to do this, but it is safer
if this is how it is bound.  Presently, we don't bind the configuration
to responses.  This leaves us relying the bindings in HPKE, which
already cover the KEM, KDF, and AEAD identifiers.  It doesn't cover the
key identifier, but that is implicitly covered by the choice of key.

That implicit binding isn't ideal, so this approach is - on balance -
safer than what we previously had.

title: Avoid use_preconfigured_tls
body:
This method is more fragile than setting the root certificate directly
using the reqwest::ClientBuilder method.

title: Pin the encapsulated content type to "message/bhttp"
Default to system TLS when no trust store provided
body: I think this makes the tool much easier to use, especially when interacting with servers that would be deemed trusted by the system trust store.

title: Add KeyConfig::derive API.
body:
I didn't add an "unimplemented" error for the NSS variant as I'm not sure what's considered best practice for that. (Do we just panic? Carve out an error? Something else?) But the rust-hpke path is fairly straightforward.

Closes #14.

title: Make rust-hpke an option
body:
@chris-wood might be interested in this one.

You can run this by disabling default features and enabling the `rust-hpke` feature:

```
$ cargo build|test|clippy --no-default-features --features rust-hpke
```

Or in `Cargo.toml`:
```toml
[dependencies]
ohttp = {version="0.1", default-features = false, features = ["client", "server", "rust-hpke"]}
```

I might need to change the default at some point to be "rust-hpke", but this is where I'm at for the moment.
